features.feature: Establish and maintain party model registry for persons and organizations
features.source_document: GRC_Customer Engagement Management/Customer Engagement Management/Customer Management/Common Capabilities Customer/Technical design documentation (Customer)/Party Model in CEM.md
features.evidence: The central concept of the EIS Party Model is to ensure the uniqueness of each entity, and accuracy of information about these parties. The party system is designed to provide the capabilities to manage these entities and keep track of them by indexing information about them.

features.feature: Manage party relationships and household linkages across customer entities
features.source_document: GRC_Customer Engagement Management/Customer Engagement Management/Customer Management/Common Capabilities Customer/Technical design documentation (Customer)/Party Model in CEM.md
features.evidence: Primary parties typically have other types of parties associated with them. A person can be related to other persons, own assets, live and work in locations, work for or be a member of an organization. These relationships can be tracked via linkages to other parties in an ever expanding graph.

features.feature: Track party data versioning and change history for audit compliance
features.source_document: GRC_Customer Engagement Management/Customer Engagement Management/Customer Management/Common Capabilities Customer/Technical design documentation (Customer)/Party Model in CEM.md
features.evidence: Over its lifetime a party's data can change, however it is critical to maintain a clear history of changes to the party for many business reasons. The EIS Party Registry provides the ability to keep multiple versions active or propagate changes.
